items.name: mapred_reduce_tasks
items.displayName: Default Number of Reduce Tasks per Job
items.description: The default number of reduce tasks per job. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapred_submit_replication
items.description: The replication level for submitted job files.
items.validationMessage: mapred_submit_replication is less than or equal to number of datanodes 3.

items.name: client_config_root_dir
items.description: The directory where the client configs will be deployed

items.name: yarn_app_mapreduce_am_resource_cpu_vcores
items.description: The virtual CPU cores requirement, for the ApplicationMaster. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.

items.name: mapred_task_timeout
items.description: The number of milliseconds before a task will be terminated if it neither reads an input, writes an output, nor updates its status string.

items.name: mapreduce_client_java_opts
items.description: These are Java command line arguments. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: io_sort_mb
items.description: The total amount of memory buffer, in megabytes, to use while sorting files. Note that this memory comes out of the user JVM heap size (meaning total user JVM heap - this amount of memory = total user usable heap space.  Note that Cloudera's default differs from Hadoop's default; Cloudera uses a bigger buffer by default because modern machines often have more RAM. The smallest value across all TaskTrackers will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapreduce_reduce_memory_mb
items.description: The amount of physical memory, in MiB, allocated for each reduce task of a job. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for Gateway logs

items.name: catch_events
items.description: When set, each role identifies important log events and forwards them to Cloudera Manager.

items.name: io_sort_spill_percent
items.description: The soft limit in either the buffer or record collection buffers. When this limit is reached, a thread will begin to spill the contents to disk in the background. Note that this does not imply any chunking of data to the spill. A value less than 0.5 is not recommended. The syntax is in decimal units; the default is 80% and is formatted 0.8. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapreduce_map_java_opts
items.description: Java opts for the map processes. The following symbol, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced by current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged. For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in /tmp pass a value of: "-verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc". The configuration variable 'Map Task Memory' can be used to control the maximum memory of the map processes.

items.name: mapred_output_compression_type
items.displayName: Compression Type of MapReduce Job Output
items.description: For MapReduce job outputs that are compressed as SequenceFiles, you can select one of these compression type options: NONE, RECORD or BLOCK. Cloudera recommends BLOCK. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: io_sort_factor
items.description: The number of streams to merge at the same time while sorting files. That is, the number of sort heads to use during the merge sort on the reducer side. This determines the number of open file handles. Merging more files in parallel reduces merge sort iterations and improves run time by eliminating disk I/O. Note that merging more files in parallel uses more memory. If 'io.sort.factor' is set too high or the maximum JVM heap is set too low, excessive garbage collection will occur. The Hadoop default is 10, but Cloudera recommends a higher value. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapreduce_jobtracker_split_metainfo_maxsize
items.description: The maximum permissible size of the split metainfo file. The JobTracker won't attempt to read split metainfo files bigger than the configured value. No limits if set to -1.

items.name: yarn_client_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: YARN Client Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for yarn-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into the client configuration for yarn-site.xml.

items.name: client_config_priority
items.description: The priority level that the client configuration will have in the Alternatives system on the hosts. Higher priority levels will cause Alternatives to prefer this configuration over any others.

items.name: mapred_reduce_tasks_speculative_execution
items.description: If enabled, multiple instances of some reduce tasks may be executed in parallel.

items.name: mapred_output_compression_codec
items.displayName: Compression Codec of MapReduce Job Output
items.description: For MapReduce job outputs that are compressed, specify the compression codec to use. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapred_map_tasks_speculative_execution
items.description: If enabled, multiple instances of some map tasks may be executed in parallel.

items.name: mapreduce_job_ubertask_maxbytes
items.description: Threshold for number of input bytes, beyond which a job is considered too big for ubertask optimization. If no value is specified, dfs.block.size is used as a default.

items.name: mapreduce_client_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: MapReduce Client Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for mapred-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into the client configuration for mapred-site.xml.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: Gateway Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: mapred_reduce_parallel_copies
items.displayName: Default Number of Parallel Transfers During Shuffle
items.description: The default number of parallel transfers run by reduce during the copy (shuffle) phase. This number should be between sqrt(nodes*number_of_map_slots_per_node) and nodes*number_of_map_slots_per_node/2. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapreduce_job_ubertask_enabled
items.description: Whether to enable ubertask optimization, which runs "sufficiently small" jobs sequentially within a single JVM. "Small" is defined by the mapreduce.job.ubertask.maxmaps, mapreduce.job.ubertask.maxreduces, and mapreduce.job.ubertask.maxbytes settings.

items.name: hadoop_job_history_dir
items.description: Location to store the job history files of running jobs. This is a path on the host where the JobTracker is running.

items.name: zlib_compress_level
items.description: Compression level for the codec used to compress MapReduce outputs. Default compression is a balance between speed and compression ratio.

items.name: client_failover_sleep_max
items.description: Maximum sleep time between failover attempts. Used only if RM HA is enabled.

items.name: mapreduce_reduce_java_opts_max_heap
items.description: The maximum Java heap size, in bytes, of the reduce processes. This number will be formatted and concatenated with 'Reduce Task Java Opts Base' to pass to Hadoop.

items.name: mapreduce_enable_native_map_output_collector
items.description: Whether map tasks should attempt to use the optimized native implementation of the map-side output collector. This can improve performance of many jobs that are shuffle-intensive. Experimental in CDH 5.2.

items.name: yarn_app_mapreduce_am_command_opts
items.description: Java command line arguments passed to the MapReduce ApplicationMaster.

items.name: mapred_map_output_compression_codec
items.displayName: Compression Codec of MapReduce Map Output
items.description: For MapReduce map outputs that are compressed, specify the compression codec to use. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapred_compress_map_output
items.description: If enabled, uses compression on the map outputs before they are sent across the network. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapreduce_job_ubertask_maxreduces
items.description: Threshold for number of reduces, beyond which a job is considered too big for ubertask optimization. Note: As of CDH 5, MR2 does not support more than one reduce in an ubertask. (Zero is valid.)

items.name: mapreduce_map_cpu_vcores
items.description: The number of virtual CPU cores allocated for each map task of a job. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.

items.name: yarn_app_mapreduce_am_admin_user_env
items.description: Environment variables for the MapReduce ApplicationMaster. These settings can be overridden in the ApplicationMaster User Environment (yarn.app.mapreduce.am.env).

items.name: mapreduce_client_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Gateway Client Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for hadoop-env.sh
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into the client configuration for hadoop-env.sh

items.name: mapreduce_shuffle_max_connections
items.description: Maximum allowed connections for the shuffle. Set to 0 (zero) to indicate no limit on the number of connections.

items.name: mapreduce_reduce_java_opts
items.description: Java opts for the reduce processes. The following symbol, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced by current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged. For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in /tmp pass a value of: "-verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc". The configuration variable 'Reduce Task Memory' can be used to control the maximum memory of the reduce processes.

items.name: mapred_output_compress
items.description: Compress the output of MapReduce jobs. Will be part of generated client configuration.

items.name: mapreduce_job_counters_limit
items.description: Limit on the number of counters allowed per job.

items.name: mapreduce_admin_user_env
items.description: Additional execution environment entries for map and reduce task processes.

items.name: mapreduce_reduce_cpu_vcores
items.description: The number of virtual CPU cores for each reduce task of a job.

items.name: io_file_buffer_size
items.description: Size of buffer for read and write operations of SequenceFiles.

items.name: mapreduce_map_java_opts_max_heap
items.description: The maximum Java heap size, in bytes, of the map processes. This number will be formatted and concatenated with 'Map Task Java Opts Base' to pass to Hadoop.

items.name: mapreduce_am_max_attempts
items.displayName: Maximum Number of Attempts for MapReduce Jobs
items.description: The maximum number of application attempts for MapReduce jobs. The value of this parameter overrides ApplicationMaster Maximum Attempts for MapReduce jobs.

items.name: mapred_reduce_slowstart_completed_maps
items.displayName: Number of Map Tasks to Complete Before Reduce Tasks
items.description: Fraction of the number of map tasks in the job which should be completed before reduce tasks are scheduled for the job.

items.name: mapreduce_framework_name
items.description: The application framework to run jobs with. If not set, jobs will be run with the local job runner.

items.name: mapreduce_cluster_temp_dir
items.description: A shared directory for temporary files.

items.name: mapreduce_map_memory_mb
items.description: The amount of physical memory, in MiB, allocated for each map task of a job.

items.name: mapreduce_application_classpath
items.description: Classpaths to include for MapReduce applications.

items.name: yarn_app_mapreduce_am_resource_mb
items.description: The physical memory requirement, in MiB, for the ApplicationMaster.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: yarn_app_mapreduce_am_max_heap
items.description: The maximum heap size, in bytes, of the Java MapReduce ApplicationMaster. This number will be formatted and concatenated with 'ApplicationMaster Java Opts Base' to pass to Hadoop.

items.name: client_failover_sleep_base
items.description: Base sleep time between failover attempts. Used only if RM HA is enabled.

items.name: mapreduce_client_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Client Java Heap Size in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: mapreduce_job_ubertask_maxmaps
items.description: Threshold for number of maps, beyond which a job is considered too big for ubertask optimization.

items.name: mr2_jobhistory_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of JobHistory Server in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: mapreduce_jobhistory_max_age_ms
items.description: Job history files older than this time duration will deleted when the history cleaner runs.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for JobHistory Server logs

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: mapreduce_jobhistory_webapp_address
items.displayName: MapReduce JobHistory Web Application HTTP Port
items.description: The HTTP port of the MapReduce JobHistory Server web application. Together with the host name of the JobHistory role forms the address.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: mapreduce_jobhistory_admin_address
items.displayName: MapReduce JobHistory Server Admin Interface Port
items.description: The port of the MapReduce JobHistory Server administrative interface. Together with the host name of the JobHistory role forms the address.

items.name: mapreduce_jobhistory_address
items.description: The port of the MapReduce JobHistory Server. Together with the hostname of the JobHistory role, forms the address.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: mapreduce_jobhistory_webapp_https_address
items.displayName: MapReduce JobHistory Web Application HTTPS Port (SSL)
items.description: The HTTPS port of the MapReduce JobHistory Server web application. Together with the host name of the JobHistory role forms the address.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: jobhistory_gc_duration_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for the weighted average time spent in Java garbage collection. Specified as a percentage of elapsed wall clock time.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: log_event_whitelist
items.displayName: Rules to Extract Events from Log Files
items.description:
This file contains the rules which govern how log messages are turned into events by the custom log4j appender that this role loads. It is in JSON format, and is composed of a list of rules. Every log message is evaluated against each of these rules in turn to decide whether or not to send an event for that message.

Each rule has some or all of the following fields:

  • alert - whether or not events generated from this rule should be promoted to alerts. A value of "true" will cause alerts to be generated. If not specified, the default is "false".
  • rate (mandatory) - the maximum number of log messages matching this rule that may be sent as events every minute. If more than rate matching log messages are received in a single minute, the extra messages are ignored. If rate is less than 0, the number of messages per minute is unlimited.
  • periodminutes - the number of minutes during which the publisher will only publish rate events or fewer. If not specified, the default is one minute
  • threshold - apply this rule only to messages with this log4j severity level or above. An example is "WARN" for warning level messages or higher.
  • content - match only those messages whose contents match this regular expression.
  • exceptiontype - match only those messages which are part of an exception message. The exception type must match this regular expression.

Example:{"alert": false, "rate": 10, "exceptiontype": "java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException"}

This rule will send events to Cloudera Manager for every StringIndexOutOfBoundsException, up to a maximum of 10 every minute.

items.name: jobhistory_mapred_safety_valve
items.displayName: JobHistory Server Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for mapred-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into mapred-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: JobHistory Server Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: max_log_size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for JobHistory Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: history_process_username
items.description: The user that the JobHistory Server process should run as.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled
items.displayName: Dump Heap When Out of Memory
items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: mr2_jobhistory_log_dir
items.description: Directory where JobHistory Server will place its log files.

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.displayName: JobHistory Server Maximum Log File Backups
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for JobHistory Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: jobhistory_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall JobHistory Server health, consider the host's health.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: yarn_jobhistory_bind_wildcard
items.displayName: Bind JobHistory Server to Wildcard Address
items.description: If enabled, the JobHistory Server binds to the wildcard address ("0.0.0.0") on all of its ports.

items.name: kerberos_role_princ_name
items.description: Kerberos principal used by the JobHistory Server roles.

items.name: jobhistory_web_metric_collection_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the duration of the metrics request to the web server.

items.name: yarn_app_mapreduce_am_staging_dir
items.description: The root HDFS directory of the staging area for users' MR2 jobs; for example /user. The staging directories are always named after the user.

items.name: JOBHISTORY_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: JobHistory Server Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: jobhistory_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: mapreduce_jobhistory_cleaner_interval
items.description: Time interval for history cleaner to check for files to delete. Files are only deleted if they are older than mapreduce.jobhistory.max-age-ms.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: mr2_jobhistory_java_opts
items.displayName: Java Configuration Options for JobHistory Server
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: jobhistory_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the JobHistory Server's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: history_process_groupname
items.description: The group that the JobHistory Server process should run as.

items.name: jobhistory_web_metric_collection_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Cloudera Manager Agent can successfully contact and gather metrics from the web server.

items.name: jobhistory_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: JobHistory Server Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for yarn-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into yarn-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: jobhistory_gc_duration_window
items.description: The period to review when computing the moving average of garbage collection time.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: node_manager_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of NodeManager in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_heartbeat_interval_ms
items.description: Heartbeat interval to ResourceManager

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_local_dirs
items.description: List of directories on the local filesystem where a NodeManager stores intermediate data files.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_resource_memory_mb
items.description: Amount of physical memory, in MiB, that can be allocated for containers.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_env_whitelist
items.description: Environment variables that containers may override rather than use NodeManager's default.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_container_manager_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads container manager uses.

items.name: nodemanager_connectivity_tolerance_seconds
items.description: The amount of time to wait for the NodeManager to fully start up and connect to the ResourceManager before enforcing the connectivity check.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for NodeManager logs

items.name: nodemanager_mapred_safety_valve
items.displayName: NodeManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for mapred-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into mapred-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_admin_env
items.description: Environment variables that should be forwarded from the NodeManager's environment to the container's.

items.name: mapreduce_aux_service
items.description: If enabled, adds 'org.apache.hadoop.mapred.ShuffleHandler' to the NodeManager auxiliary services.  This is required for MapReduce applications.

items.name: nodemanager_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_cache_cleanup_interval_ms
items.description: Address where the localizer IPC is.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_address
items.description: Address where the localizer IPC is.

items.name: nodemanager_webserver_port
items.description: The HTTP Port of the NodeManager web application.

items.name: mapred_healthchecker_script_path
items.description: Absolute path to the script which is periodically run by the node health monitoring service to determine if the node is healthy or not. If the value of this key is empty or the file does not exist in the location configured here, the node health monitoring service is not started.

items.name: nodemanager_gc_duration_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for the weighted average time spent in Java garbage collection. Specified as a percentage of elapsed wall clock time.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: nodemanager_web_metric_collection_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the duration of the metrics request to the web server.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: nodemanager_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: NodeManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for yarn-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into yarn-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: log_event_whitelist
items.displayName: Rules to Extract Events from Log Files
items.description:
This file contains the rules which govern how log messages are turned into events by the custom log4j appender that this role loads. It is in JSON format, and is composed of a list of rules. Every log message is evaluated against each of these rules in turn to decide whether or not to send an event for that message.

Each rule has some or all of the following fields:

  • alert - whether or not events generated from this rule should be promoted to alerts. A value of "true" will cause alerts to be generated. If not specified, the default is "false".
  • rate (mandatory) - the maximum number of log messages matching this rule that may be sent as events every minute. If more than rate matching log messages are received in a single minute, the extra messages are ignored. If rate is less than 0, the number of messages per minute is unlimited.
  • periodminutes - the number of minutes during which the publisher will only publish rate events or fewer. If not specified, the default is one minute
  • threshold - apply this rule only to messages with this log4j severity level or above. An example is "WARN" for warning level messages or higher.
  • content - match only those messages whose contents match this regular expression.
  • exceptiontype - match only those messages which are part of an exception message. The exception type must match this regular expression.

Example:{"alert": false, "rate": 10, "exceptiontype": "java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException"}

This rule will send events to Cloudera Manager for every StringIndexOutOfBoundsException, up to a maximum of 10 every minute.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: nodemanager_web_metric_collection_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Cloudera Manager Agent can successfully contact and gather metrics from the web server.

items.name: nodemanager_recovery_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Recovery Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's The local filesystem directory in which the NodeManager stores state when recovery is enabled. Recovery is enabled by default..

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_remote_app_log_dir_suffix
items.description: The remote log dir will be created at {yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir}/${user}/{thisParam}

items.name: nodemanager_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the NodeManager's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: NodeManager Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: max_log_size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for NodeManager logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_recovery_dir
items.description: The local filesystem directory in which the NodeManager stores state when recovery is enabled. Recovery is enabled by default.

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: container_executor_allowed_system_users

items.name: linux_container_executor_cgroups_hierarchy
items.description: Path (rooted in the cgroups hierarchy on the machine) where to place YARN-managed cgroups.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled

items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_resource_cpu_vcores
items.description: Number of virtual CPU cores that can be allocated for containers. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for NodeManager logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_cache_target_size_mb
items.description: Target size of localizer cache in MB, per local directory.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: nodemanager_connectivity_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health check that verifies the NodeManager is connected to the ResourceManager

items.name: NODEMANAGER_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: NodeManager Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: node_manager_java_opts
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: node_manager_log_dir
items.description: Directory where NodeManager will place its log files.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_address
items.description: The address of the NodeManager IPC.

items.name: nodemanager_recovery_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Recovery Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's The local filesystem directory in which the NodeManager stores state when recovery is enabled. Recovery is enabled by default.. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a The local filesystem directory in which the NodeManager stores state when recovery is enabled. Recovery is enabled by default. Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: mapred_healthchecker_script_args
items.description: Comma-separated list of arguments which are to be passed to node health script when it is being launched.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_delete_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads used in cleanup.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: container_executor_min_user_id
items.description: The minimum Linux user ID allowed.  Used to prevent other super users.

items.name: nodemanager_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall NodeManager health, consider the host's health.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: container_executor_group
items.description: The system group that owns the container-executor binary. This does not need to be changed unless the ownership of the binary is explicitly changed.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: nodemanager_local_data_directories_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Local Directories Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's List of directories on the local filesystem where a NodeManager stores intermediate data files..

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_client_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads to handle localization requests.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: nodemanager_local_data_directories_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: NodeManager Local Directories Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's List of directories on the local filesystem where a NodeManager stores intermediate data files.. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a List of directories on the local filesystem where a NodeManager stores intermediate data files. Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: hadoop_metrics2_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hadoop Metrics2 Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for Hadoop Metrics2. Properties will be inserted into hadoop-metrics2.properties.

items.name: container_executor_banned_users
items.description: List of users banned from running containers.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: nodemanager_webserver_https_port
items.description: The HTTPS port of the NodeManager web application.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_delete_debug_delay_sec
items.description: Number of seconds after an application finishes before the NodeManager's DeletionService will delete the application's localized file and log directory. To diagnose YARN application problems, set this property's value large enough (for example, to 600 = 10 minutes) to permit examination of these directories.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: nodemanager_gc_duration_window
items.description: The period to review when computing the moving average of garbage collection time.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_log_dirs
items.description: List of directories on the local filesystem where a NodeManager stores container log files.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_localizer_fetch_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads to use for localization fetching.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_log_retain_seconds
items.description: Time in seconds to retain user logs. Only applicable if log aggregation is disabled.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_remote_app_log_dir
items.description: HDFS directory where application logs are stored when an application completes.

items.name: resource_manager_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of ResourceManager in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_maximum_allocation_mb
items.description: The largest amount of physical memory, in MiB, that can be requested for a container.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_maximum_allocation_vcores
items.description: The largest number of virtual CPU cores that can be requested for a container. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.

items.name: resourcemanager_gc_duration_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for the weighted average time spent in Java garbage collection. Specified as a percentage of elapsed wall clock time.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_admin_client_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads used to handle the ResourceManager admin interface.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_increment_allocation_vcores
items.description: If using the Fair Scheduler, virtual core requests will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of this number. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 5.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_container_liveness_monitor_interval_ms
items.description: The periodic interval that the ResourceManager will check whether containers are still alive.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_scheduler_address
items.description: The address of the scheduler interface in the ResourceManager.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for ResourceManager logs

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_locality_threshold_node
items.description: For applications that request containers on particular nodes, the number of scheduling opportunities since the last container assignment to wait before accepting a placement on another node. Expressed as a float between 0 and 1, which, as a fraction of the cluster size, is the number of scheduling opportunities to pass up. If not set, this means don't pass up any scheduling opportunities. Requires Fair Scheduler continuous scheduling to be disabled. If continuous scheduling is enabled, yarn.scheduler.fair.locality-delay-node-ms should be used instead.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_recovery_enabled
items.description: When enabled, any applications that were running on the cluster when the ResourceManager died will be recovered when the ResourceManager next starts. Note: If RM-HA is enabled, then this configuration is always enabled.

items.name: resourcemanager_web_metric_collection_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Cloudera Manager Agent can successfully contact and gather metrics from the web server.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_size_based_weight
items.description: When enabled, the Fair Scheduler will assign shares to individual apps based on their size, rather than providing an equal share to all apps regardless of size.

items.name: resourcemanager_startup_tolerance_minutes
items.description: The amount of time allowed after this role is started that failures of health checks that rely on communication with this role will be tolerated.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_minimum_allocation_vcores
items.description: The smallest number of virtual CPU cores that can be requested for a container. If using the Capacity or FIFO scheduler (or any scheduler, prior to CDH 5), virtual core requests will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of this number. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: yarn_nm_liveness_monitor_expiry_interval_ms
items.description: The expiry interval to wait until a NodeManager is considered dead.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: resource_manager_java_opts
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_address
items.description: The address of the applications manager interface in the ResourceManager.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: log_event_whitelist
items.displayName: Rules to Extract Events from Log Files
items.description:
This file contains the rules which govern how log messages are turned into events by the custom log4j appender that this role loads. It is in JSON format, and is composed of a list of rules. Every log message is evaluated against each of these rules in turn to decide whether or not to send an event for that message.

Each rule has some or all of the following fields:

  • alert - whether or not events generated from this rule should be promoted to alerts. A value of "true" will cause alerts to be generated. If not specified, the default is "false".
  • rate (mandatory) - the maximum number of log messages matching this rule that may be sent as events every minute. If more than rate matching log messages are received in a single minute, the extra messages are ignored. If rate is less than 0, the number of messages per minute is unlimited.
  • periodminutes - the number of minutes during which the publisher will only publish rate events or fewer. If not specified, the default is one minute
  • threshold - apply this rule only to messages with this log4j severity level or above. An example is "WARN" for warning level messages or higher.
  • content - match only those messages whose contents match this regular expression.
  • exceptiontype - match only those messages which are part of an exception message. The exception type must match this regular expression.

Example:{"alert": false, "rate": 10, "exceptiontype": "java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException"}

This rule will send events to Cloudera Manager for every StringIndexOutOfBoundsException, up to a maximum of 10 every minute.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_resource_tracker_address

items.description: The timeout for the ResourceManager's session with ZooKeeper. The session will expire if the ZooKeeper ensemble does not hear from the ResourceManager within the specified timeout period (i.e. no heartbeat). Note that session expiration is managed by the ZooKeeper ensemble, not by the ResourceManager.

Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: yarn_rm_bind_wildcard
items.description: If enabled, the ResourceManager binds to the wildcard address ("0.0.0.0") on all of its ports.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_increment_allocation_mb
items.description: If using the Fair Scheduler, memory requests will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of this number. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 5.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_preemption
items.description: When enabled, if a pool's minimum share is not met for some period of time, the Fair Scheduler preempts applications in other pools. Preemption guarantees that production applications are not starved while also allowing the cluster to be used for experimental and research applications. To minimize wasted computation, the Fair Scheduler preempts the most recently launched applications.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_assign_multiple
items.description: Enables multiple Fair Scheduler container assignments in one heartbeat, which improves cluster throughput when there are many small tasks to run.

items.name: resourcemanager_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall ResourceManager health, consider the host's health.

items.name: resourcemanager_gc_duration_window
items.description: The period to review when computing the moving average of garbage collection time.

Expressed as a float between 0 and 1, which, as a fraction of the cluster size, is the number of scheduling opportunities to pass up. If not set, this means don't pass up any scheduling opportunities. Requires Fair Scheduler continuous scheduling to be disabled. If continuous scheduling is enabled, yarn.scheduler.fair.locality-delay-rack-ms should be used instead.

items.description: Number of threads to handle resource tracker calls.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.description: When enabled, ResourceManager has proxy user privileges.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_amliveliness_monitor_interval_ms
items.description: The periodic interval that the ResourceManager will check whether ApplicationMasters is still alive.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_fair_continuous_scheduling_enabled
items.description: Enable continuous scheduling in the Fair Scheduler. When enabled, scheduling decisions are decoupled from NodeManager heartbeats, leading to faster resource allocations.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: yarn_am_liveness_monitor_expiry_interval_ms
items.description: The expiry interval to wait until an ApplicationMaster is considered dead.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_scheduler_class
items.description: The class to use as the resource scheduler.  FairScheduler is only supported in CDH 4.2.1 and later.

items.name: resourcemanager_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_max_completed_applications
items.description: The maximum number of completed applications that the ResourceManager keeps.

items.name: hadoop_metrics2_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hadoop Metrics2 Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for Hadoop Metrics2. Properties will be inserted into hadoop-metrics2.properties.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_user_as_default_queue
items.displayName: Fair Scheduler User As Default Queue
items.description: When set to true, the Fair Scheduler uses the username as the default pool name, in the event that a pool name is not specified. When set to false, all applications are run in a shared pool, called default.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_fair_locality_delay_node_ms
items.description: For applications that request containers on particular nodes, the minimum time in milliseconds the Fair Scheduler waits before accepting a placement on another node. Requires Fair Scheduler continuous scheduling to be enabled. If continuous scheduling is disabled, yarn.scheduler.fair.locality.threshold.node should be used instead.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_fair_locality_delay_rack_ms
items.description: For applications that request containers on particular racks, the minimum time in milliseconds the Fair Scheduler waits before accepting a placement on another rack. Requires Fair Scheduler continuous scheduling to be enabled. If continuous scheduling is disabled, yarn.scheduler.fair.locality.threshold.rack should be used instead.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_configuration
items.displayName: Fair Scheduler XML Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: An XML string that will be inserted verbatim into the Fair Scheduler allocations file. For CDH5, overrides the configuration set using the Pools configuration UI. For CDH4, this is the only way to configure the Fair Scheduler for YARN.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: resourcemanager_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the ResourceManager's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_minimum_allocation_mb
items.description: The smallest amount of physical memory, in MiB, that can be requested for a container. If using the Capacity or FIFO scheduler (or any scheduler, prior to CDH 5), memory requests will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of this number.

items.name: resourcemanager_capacity_scheduler_configuration
items.displayName: Capacity Scheduler Configuration Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Enter an XML string that represents the Capacity Scheduler configuration.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_am_max_retries
items.description: The maximum number of application attempts. This is a global setting for all ApplicationMasters. Each ApplicationMaster can specify its individual maximum through the API, but if the individual maximum is more than the global maximum, the ResourceManager overrides it.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_scheduler_client_thread_count
items.description: The number of threads used to handle requests through the scheduler interface.

items.name: hdfs_service
items.description: Name of the HDFS service that this YARN service instance depends on

items.name: zookeeper_service
items.description: Name of the ZooKeeper service that this YARN service instance depends on

items.name: yarn_scheduler_fair_allow_undeclared_pools
items.description: When set to true, pools specified in applications but not explicitly configured, are created at runtime with default settings. When set to false, applications specifying pools not explicitly configured run in a pool named default. This setting applies when an application explicitly specifies a pool and when the application runs in a pool named with the username associated with the application.

items.name: ssl_client_truststore_password
items.description: Password for the SSL client truststore. Overrides the cluster-wide default truststore password set in HDFS.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_activation_startup_tolerance
items.description: The amount of time after ResourceManager(s) start that the lack of an active ResourceManager will be tolerated. This is an advanced option that does not often need to be changed.

items.name: admin_application_list_settings
items.displayName: Admin Users Applications List Visibility Settings
items.description: Controls which applications an admin user can see in the applications list view

items.name: smon_derived_configs_safety_valve
items.displayName: Service Monitor Derived Configs Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a list of derived configuration properties that will be used by the Service Monitor instead of the default ones.

items.name: catch_events
items.description: When set, each role identifies important log events and forwards them to Cloudera Manager.

items.name: yarn_log_aggregation_retain_seconds
items.description: How long to keep aggregation logs before deleting them.

items.name: ssl_server_keystore_keypassword
items.displayName: Hadoop SSL Server Keystore Key Password
items.description: Password that protects the private key contained in the server keystore used for encrypted shuffle and encrypted web UIs. Applies to all configurations of daemon roles of this service.

items.name: hadoop_secure_web_ui
items.displayName: Enable Kerberos Authentication for HTTP Web-Consoles
items.description: Enables Kerberos authentication for Hadoop HTTP web consoles for all roles of this service using the SPNEGO protocol. Note: This is effective only if Kerberos is enabled for the HDFS service.

items.name: yarn_application_aggregates
items.description: Controls the aggregate metrics generated for YARN applications. The structure is a JSON list of the attributes to aggregate and the entities to aggregate to. For example, if the attributeName is 'maps_completed' and the aggregationTargets is ['USER'] then the Service Monitor will create the metric 'yarn_application_maps_completed_rate' and, every ten minutes, will record the total maps completed for each user across all their YARN applications. By default it will also record the number of applications submitted ('apps_submitted_rate') for both users and pool. For a full list of the supported attributes see the YARN search page. Note that the valid aggregation targets are USER, YARN_POOL, and YARN (the service), and that these aggregate metrics can be viewed on both the reports and charts search pages.

items.name: yarn_standby_resourcemanager_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall YARN service health, whether to consider the health of the standby ResourceManager.

items.name: yarn_service_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: YARN (MR2 Included) Service Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanagers_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall YARN service health, whether to consider the active ResourceManager's health.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this service reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: yarn_service_lce_always
items.description: Whether YARN uses the Linux Container Executor both in secure (Kerberos) and insecure (not Kerberos) environments. Cgroups enforcement only works when the Linux Container Executor is used.

items.name: yarn_admin_acl
items.description: ACL that determines which users and groups can submit and kill applications in any pool, and can issue commands on ResourceManager roles.

items.name: yarn_nodemanager_linux_container_executor_nonsecure_mode_local_user
items.displayName: UNIX User for Nonsecure Mode with Linux Container Executor
items.description: UNIX user that containers run as when Linux-container-executor is used in nonsecure mode.

items.name: yarn_service_cgroups
items.description: Whether YARN creates a cgroup per container, thereby isolating the CPU usage of containers.  When set, <tt>yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.resources-handler.class</tt> is configured to <tt>org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.util.CgroupsLCEResourcesHandler</tt>. The host (in Cloudera Manager) must have cgroups enabled. The number of shares allocated to all YARN containers is configured by adjusting the CPU shares value of the Node Manager in the Resource Management configuration group.

items.name: yarn_jobhistoryserver_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall YARN health, consider JobHistory Server's health

items.name: user_application_list_settings
items.displayName: Non-Admin Users Applications List Visibility Settings
items.description: Controls which applications non-admin users can see in the applications list view

items.name: yarn_core_site_safety_valve
items.displayName: YARN Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for core-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into core-site.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: yarn_nodemanagers_healthy_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the overall NodeManager health. The check returns "Concerning" health if the percentage of "Healthy" NodeManagers falls below the warning threshold. The check is unhealthy if the total percentage of "Healthy" and "Concerning" NodeManagers falls below the critical threshold.

items.name: ssl_server_keystore_location
items.displayName: Hadoop SSL Server Keystore File Location
items.description: Path to the keystore file containing the server certificate and private key used for encrypted shuffle and encrypted web UIs. Applies to configurations of all daemon roles of this service.

items.name: service_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this service. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific service.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the followig JSON formatted trigger fires if there are more than 10 DataNodes with more than 500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleType = DataNode and last(fd_open) > 500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 10, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: yarn_active_resourcemanager_detecton_window
items.description: The tolerance window used in YARN service tests that depend on detection of the active ResourceManager.

items.name: kerberos_princ_name
items.description: Kerberos principal short name used by all roles of this service.

items.name: yarn_fs_scheduled_allocations
items.description: JSON representation of all the configurations that the Fair Scheduler can take on across all schedules. Typically edited using the Pools configuration UI.

items.name: llama_proxy_user_groups_list
items.description: Comma-delimited list of groups that you want to allow the Llama (AM for Impala) user to impersonate. The default '*' allows all groups. To disable entirely, use a string that doesn't correspond to a group name, such as '_no_group_'.

items.name: yarn_rm_ha_cluster_id
items.description: Cluster ID used when ResourceManager is Highly Available.

items.name: yarn_hadoop_policy_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: YARN Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for hadoop-policy.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hadoop-policy.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: yarn_ssl_server_safety_valve
items.displayName: YARN (MR2 Included) Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for ssl-server.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into ssl-server.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: ssl_client_truststore_location
items.description: Path to the truststore file used when roles of this service act as SSL clients. Overrides the cluster-wide default truststore location set in HDFS. This truststore must be in JKS format. The truststore contains certificates of trusted servers, or of Certificate Authorities trusted to identify servers. The contents of the truststore can be modified without restarting any roles. By default, changes to its contents are picked up within ten seconds. If not set, the default Java truststore is used to verify certificates.

items.name: yarn_service_mapred_safety_valve
items.displayName: YARN Service MapReduce Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into mapred-site.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: yarn_ssl_client_safety_valve
items.displayName: YARN (MR2 Included) Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for ssl-client.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into ssl-client.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: process_username
items.description: The user that this service's processes should run as. (Except the Job History Server, which has its own user)

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: ssl_server_keystore_password
items.displayName: Hadoop SSL Server Keystore File Password
items.description: Password for the server keystore file used for encrypted shuffle and encrypted web UIs. Applies to configurations of all daemon roles of this service.

items.name: yarn_application_classpath
items.description: Entries to add to the classpaths of YARN applications.

items.name: yarn_fs_schedule_rules
items.description: A list specifying the rules to run to determine which Fair Scheduler configuration to use. Typically edited using the Rules configuration UI.

items.name: llama_proxy_user_hosts_list
items.description: Comma-delimited list of hosts where you want to allow the Llama (AM for Impala) user to impersonate other users. The default '*' allows all hosts. To disable entirely, use a string that doesn't correspond to a host name, such as '_no_host'.

items.name: yarn_service_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: YARN Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for yarn-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into yarn-site.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: yarn_log_aggregation_enable
items.description: Whether to enable log aggregation

items.name: log_event_retry_frequency
items.description: The frequency in which the log4j event publication appender will retry sending undelivered log events to the Event server, in seconds

items.name: yarn_acl_enable
items.description: Whether users and groups specified in Admin ACL should be checked for authorization to perform admin operations.

items.name: process_groupname
items.description: The group that this service's processes should run as. (Except the Job History Server, which has its own group)

items.name: hdfs_user_home_dir
items.description: The home directory of the system user on the local filesystem. This setting must reflect the system's configured value - only changing it here will not change the actual home directory.
